TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit EventDescriptor extends System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor
Public MustInherit Class EventDescriptor Inherits MemberDescriptor
public ref class EventDescriptor abstract : System::ComponentModel::MemberDescriptor

remarks.format:
## Remarks An <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor> consists of a name, its attributes, the component that the event is bound to, the event delegate, the type of delegate, and whether the delegate is multicast.
<xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor> provides the following `abstract` properties and methods:
- <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor.ComponentType%2A> contains the type of the component this event is declared on.
- <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor.EventType%2A> contains the type of delegate for the event.
- <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor.IsMulticast%2A> contains a value indicating whether the event delegate is a multicast delegate.
- <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor.AddEventHandler%2A> binds the event to a component.
- <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor.RemoveEventHandler%2A> unbinds the delegate from the component so that the delegate no longer receives events from the component.
For more information about events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). For more information about reflection, see the topics in [Reflection](~/docs/framework/reflection-and-codedom/reflection.md).
## Examples The following code example is built upon the example in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection> class. It prints the information (category, description, and display name) of each event on a button in a text box. It requires that `button1` and `textbox1` have been instantiated on a form.
[!code-cpp[EventDescriptor#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/EventDescriptor/CPP/eventdescriptor.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[EventDescriptor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/EventDescriptor/CS/eventdescriptor.cs#1)] [!code-vb[EventDescriptor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/EventDescriptor/VB/eventdescriptor.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void AddEventHandler (object component, Delegate value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddEventHandler(object component, class System.Delegate value) cil managed
Public MustOverride Sub AddEventHandler (component As Object, value As Delegate)
public: abstract void AddEventHandler(System::Object ^ component, Delegate ^ value);
abstract member AddEventHandler : obj * Delegate -> unit

Docs.param: A component that provides events to the delegate.
A delegate that represents the method that handles the event.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, binds the event to the component.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, this method is implemented through reflection. For more information about reflection, see the topics in [Reflection](~/docs/framework/reflection-and-codedom/reflection.md).
For more information about delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).

block.para: When you override this method, it should add the delegate to the component's event list by invoking the appropriate add_myHandler method.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool IsMulticast { get; }
.property instance bool IsMulticast
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsMulticast As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsMulticast { bool get(); };
member this.IsMulticast : bool

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the event delegate is a multicast delegate.
Docs.value: if the event delegate is multicast; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, this property is implemented through reflection.
A multicast delegate differs from a regular delegate in that it can contain references to more than just one method. Methods in a multicast delegate are executed synchronously when the delegate is invoked, in the order in which they appear. If one of the called methods raises an exception, then the delegate ceases and the exception is propagated to the delegate caller.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void RemoveEventHandler (object component, Delegate value);

Docs.param: The component that the delegate is bound to.
The delegate to unbind from the component.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, unbinds the delegate from the component so that the delegate will no longer receive events from the component.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, this method is implemented through reflection. For more information, see the topics in [Reflection](~/docs/framework/reflection-and-codedom/reflection.md).
For more information about delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).

block.para: When you override this method, it should remove the delegate from the component's event list by invoking the appropriate remove_myHandler method.
